title: Miscellaneous functions, not yet intended for distribution
text: installing latest release R package run following code :
code: # Enable repository from kwb-r options(repos = c(   kwbr = 'https://kwb-r.r-universe.dev',   CRAN = 'https://cloud.r-project.org'))  # Download and install kwb.misc in R install.packages('kwb.misc')  # Browse the kwb.misc manual pages help(package = 'kwb.misc')

title: All Timeshift Plots — hsAllTimeshiftPlots
text: one water quality parameter, overflow events given "evt" plotted different scales given "fracts" (fractions interval length). time-series water quality parameter container, upstream downstream plotted time well flow.

title: All Timeshift Plots — hsAllTimeshiftPlots
code: hsAllTimeshiftPlots(   frmOrig,   frmUs,   frmDs,   evt,   fieldNames,   plusOverview = FALSE,   type1 = "l",   fracts = c(0, 0.75, 0.5, 0.25, 0.1, 0.05),   fieldPrefix = "" )

title: All Timeshift Plots — hsAllTimeshiftPlots
text: frmOrig Original time-series frmUs upstream shifted time-series frmDs downstream shifted time-series evt event list fieldNames vector containing relevant table field names named elements: tsOrig: timestamp Q time-series),  tsUsDs: timestamp us/ds time-series), fieldQ: name field containing Q, fieldP: name field containing wq parameter plusOverview true, one plot comprising whole time-series frmOrig added type1 Plot type (default: "l" = line) fracts Vector scaling factors. factor plot generated representing corresponding fraction whole time interval event.  factor zero plot whole event. fieldPrefix Default: ""

title: hsCoefAna — hsCoefAna
text: regression coefficient analysis

title: hsCoefAna — hsCoefAna
code: hsCoefAna(   data,   recursive = TRUE,   evtNums = unique(data$evtID),   aslist = recursive,   uselm = FALSE,   prep = FALSE,   ...,   dbg.level = max(2, length(evtNums) - 8) )

title: hsCoefAna — hsCoefAna
text: data data frame containing columns tstamp (time stamp), pval (probe value), lval (lab value), evtID (event ID) recursive TRUE, recursive version hsCoefAnaRes regression coefficient  analysis used, otherwise non-recursive version. default: TRUE evtNums event numbers considered analysis. considered recursive == TRUE. default: distinct values provided  column evtID data) aslist default: boolean value given recursive uselm TRUE, lm function used calculate linear regression, otherwise (uselm == FALSE) regression calculated "manually"  much faster. Default: FALSE prep Default: FALSE ... arguments passed hsCombiLinReg, e.g. clever dbg.level default: max(2, length(evtNums) - 8)

title: hsCoefAnaNonRec — hsCoefAnaNonRec
text: non-recursive version regression coefficient analysis

title: hsCoefAnaNonRec — hsCoefAnaNonRec
code: hsCoefAnaNonRec(data, uselm = FALSE, aslist = FALSE, ..., dbg.level = 1)

title: hsCoefAnaNonRec — hsCoefAnaNonRec
text: data data frame containing columns tstamp (time stamp), pval (probe value), lval (lab value), evtID (event ID) uselm TRUE, lm function used calculate linear regression, otherwise (uselm == FALSE) regression calculated "manually"  much faster. default: FALSE aslist TRUE result retunred forms list list element representing one combination. otherwise forms database columns np (number points), offset, slope, combi. Default: FALSE. ... arguments passed hsCombiLinReg, e.g. clever dbg.level debug level

title: hsCoefAnaRec — hsCoefAnaRec
text: recursive version regression coefficient analysis

title: hsCoefAnaRec — hsCoefAnaRec
code: hsCoefAnaRec(   data,   evtNums = unique(data$evtID),   combi = NULL,   tree = TRUE,   resframe = NULL,   uselm = FALSE,   ...,   dbg.level = 1 )

title: hsCoefAnaRec — hsCoefAnaRec
text: data data frame containing columns tstamp (time stamp), pval (probe value), lval (lab value), evtID (event ID) evtNums event numbers considered analysis (default: distinct values provided column evtID data) combi current combination evaluated base next  combinations determined tree TRUE, result given tree structure, otherwise data frame resframe tree FALSE, argument contains results found far data frame uselm TRUE, lm function used calculate linear regression, otherwise (uselm == FALSE) regression calculated "manually"  much faster. default: FALSE ... arguments passed hsCombiLinReg, e.g. clever dbg.level debug level

title: hsCoefAnaRec — hsCoefAnaRec
text: Recursive list representing tree structure. top level list   contains elements e<> <> event IDs considered    (elements evtNums).   sub lists top level ("leafs" tree) also    contain elements e<j> <j> "remaining" event IDs,    .e. IDs yet occur "path" event IDs   leading respective sub tree. sub lists also elements combi (vector event IDs representing respective event    combination) linreg containing results linear    regression. fact, linreg data frame line    representing slope offset linear regression    np number points, taken events combi.

what: Linear Regression for Event Combination — hsCombiLinReg
title: Linear Regression for Event Combination — hsCombiLinReg
text: Calculation linear regressions given combination events

title: Linear Regression for Event Combination — hsCombiLinReg
code: hsCombiLinReg(   data,   combi,   uselm = FALSE,   clever = FALSE,   prep = FALSE,   calc.rmse = TRUE,   dbg = FALSE )

title: Linear Regression for Event Combination — hsCombiLinReg
text: data data frame containing columns tstamp (time stamp), pval (probe value), lval (lab value), evtID (event ID) combi combination events linear regressions calculated following way: first event numbers combi, positions  seq_len(length(combi) - 1), considered "base" events, .e. events data points considered linear regression.   data points belonging event given last position combi added "point point" "base points" time separate regression calculated uselm TRUE, lm function used calculate linear regression, otherwise (uselm == FALSE) regression calculated "manually"  much faster. default: FALSE clever TRUE, sums means updated knowledge previous values current data point, otherwise always recalculated datapoints considered prep TRUE, data expected contain columns x2 (squares x), xy (product x y values). Unfortunately, give better performance... calc.rmse TRUE, root mean square error (RMSE) calculated dbg TRUE, debug messages shown

title: Data Availability in time-series data — hsDataAvailability
text: data data frame timestamp first column tstep expected timestep consecutive timestamps seconds. Default: minimum time difference occurring timestamps data. interval length time intervals data grouped, seconds. Default: 60*60*24 = one day intervals; data availability calculated separately time interval. includeCount TRUE, data availability percent also number records per interval percentage calculated included separate columns result data frame. dbg TRUE, debug messages shown

text: Data availability time series data

title: Data availability of time series data — hsDataAvailability.old
text: info list named elements (mdb: full path Access database,  tbl: table name, tsField: name timestamp field,  parField: name parameter field) dateFirst Date object representing first date considered dateLast Date object representing last date considered tstep expected time step time stamps seconds. Default: minimum  time difference found consecutive timestamps given interval dbg TRUE, debug messages shown

title: Data availability of time series data — hsDataAvailability.old
text: data.frame row representing day within specified time   interval columns \(intervalBeg\) (day), \(n<Par>\)  (number non-NA-values column <Par> within interval)   \(p<Par>\) (data availability parameter <Par> percent    = number available non-NA-values divided maximum possible    number non-NA-values per day (= 86400 / tstep).

title: import SENATE's grab sample data from csv — hsImpGsData
text: csv full path csv file mdb full path MS Access database (*.mdb) sep separator csv file dateFormat date format csv file (default: %d/%m/%Y) blockBeginPtrn pattern indicating begin data block file (default: Messstelle) tblNamePtrn table name pattern. Default: "tblSenGrabSmp_@M" placeholder @M replaced acronym monitoring point boolAsk logical passed hsWriteBlockToTable dbg TRUE, debug messages shown

title: Interval Sum >= Threshold — hsIntSumGeThreshold
text: index <iStart> vector values, function tries find corresponding index <iStop> way sum vector elements indices <iStart> <iStop> reaches given threshold. possible start index , algorithm starts either looking forward indices +1, +2, ... backwards indices -1, -2, ..., accumulating values indices. accumulated sum reached given threshold difference indices exceeds maximum allowed index difference maxDist algorithm stops continues next start index.

title: Interval Sum >= Threshold — hsIntSumGeThreshold
code: hsIntSumGeThreshold(   tSeries,   threshold,   forward,   maxTDiff,   tsField = names(tSeries)[1],   valField = names(tSeries)[2],   valFactor = 1,   includeIndices = TRUE,   dbg = FALSE )

title: Interval Sum >= Threshold — hsIntSumGeThreshold
text: tSeries data.frame timestamps first column values second column. threshold Threshold shall reached/exceeded sum successive elements values maximum time difference equal maxTDiff. forward TRUE, algorithm looks forward, else backwards, .e. looking forward (backwards), start indices <iStart> always less equal (greater equal) assigned indices <iStop>. maxTDiff Maximum allowed time difference seconds two related timestamps. tsField Name time stamp field; default: name first column valField Name value field containing values sum shall reach threshold; default: name second column valFactor Factor applied column valField calculating value sums. includeIndices TRUE, two columns iStart iStop included output data frame indicating indices tSeries corresponding timestamps tStart tStop. dbg TRUE, debug messages shown

title: Interval Sum >= Threshold — hsIntSumGeThreshold
text: data frame columns iStart iStop   indices tSeries represent beginning end   time interval value field sums least threshold, tStart, tStop tDiff representing   first timestamp, last timestamp duration corresponding time   intervals column sumWithin sum values   actially reached within interval.

title: Timeshift — hsTimeshift
text: hq hydraulic water quality data one data frame threshold Threshold shall reached/exceeded sum successive values column valField maximum time difference equal maxTDiff. upstream TRUE, algorithm “looks” upstream, else downstream tsField name timestamp field hq valField name column hq containing values summed threshold reached quaFields vector containing column names water quality parameters, e.g. c("AFS", "CSB", "CSBf") maxTDiff Maximum allowed time difference seconds two related timestamps. valFactor factor applied column valField calculating value sums. dbg TRUE, debug messages shown

text: plot generated, containing flow measurements well measurements (original, upstream/downstream time-shifted) one water quality parameter one overflow events contained event list "evt".

title: Timeshift Plot — hsTimeshiftPlot
text: frmOrig data frame original measurements frmUs data frame measurements time-shifted upstream frmDs data frame measurements time-shifted downstream evt event list fieldNames field names index evtDurFract event duration fraction type1 plot type, e.g. "p" "points", passed plot boolOverview overview plotted? fieldPrefix field prefix

code: plot_rain_events(   rain,   strTimestamp = "Zeitstempel",   strPdf = NULL,   irng = c(1, -1),   myCex = 0.7,   myMinN,   evtSepTime_s = 60 * 60 * 6,   sigWidth_s = 300,   events = TRUE )

title: plot rain events from given rain data — plot_rain_events
text: rain data frame containing rain data strTimestamp name timestamp field, default: "Zeitstempel" strPdf optional. path output pdf file irng vector two integer values determining first last index, respectively, data frame events (created within function)  plotted. Second element can -1 indicate index last event. Default: c(1, -1) myCex default: 0.7 myMinN minimum precipitation mm. Events total depth less  value plotted evtSepTime_s event separation time seconds. Default: 6*3600 = 6 hours sigWidth_s rain signal width seconds. Default: 300 = 5 minutes events one plot per event (events = TRUE) one plot per day (events = FALSE)? default: TRUE
